intro: Marginaria arisanensis, commonly known as the Arisan marginaria, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, aromatic scent. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
